abstract: Nelson Peltz’s Trian Fund Management has quietly amassed a stake of more than $2.7 billion in the two companies. He wants Pepsi to acquire Mondelez in an all-stock transaction worth $35 to $38 a share and then spin off its beverage business.
snippet: Nelson Peltz’s Trian Fund Management has quietly amassed a stake of more than $2.7 billion in the two companies. He wants Pepsi to acquire Mondelez in an all-stock transaction worth $35 to $38 a share and then spin off its beverage business.
lead_paragraph: The activist investor Nelson Peltz said on Wednesday that he would seek a merger of PepsiCo and Mondelez International, going public with his plans after months of speculation.

headline.main: Activist Peltz Urges Merger of PepsiCo and Mondelez
